posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Hi all, I'm new here. I'm thinking of a build idea. I'm thinking of a Bard/Assassin/Shadowdancer.

I need a LOT of HELP PLEASE!

Levels: Thinking about Bard 7/Assassin 6/Shadowdancer 6 for a 19th level character against the OC

But maybe a different level allotment is better.

Race: Elf or Halfling. Which? Why?

Starting stats

Str 12

Dex 18(stat point at 12 level to combine with either a +3 or +5 dex item for either a 22, 24 Dex)

Con 12

Int 12(Stat point at 8th Level to get to 13 for expertise)

Wis 9(stat point at 4th level to eliminate penalty)

Cha 13

Feats(pool of idea feats. More then legal limit)

Dodge(start), Finesse(3rd Level), Mobility (6th level), Expertise (9th level), Whirlwind Attack, Improved Critical, Cleave

Welcome, need more ideas.

Skills Hide 10+, Move Silently 8+, Tumble 5+, Disable Device, Open Locks, Listen, Concentration, Spellcraft, Perform, Parry, UMD, etc

Basic Concept:

Strengths

Very High, as high as can get AC.

Can Parry attacks that get by AC

Assassin poison death attacks

Hide in Plain Sight, Summon Shadow

Darkness

Lots of attacks per round

Spellcasting

Healing

UMD

Ranged, Melee, Ambush, Assassin, Ninja, death attacks

Hiding

VERSATILITY

Weaknesses

Lower HP

Deferred Power

Less Damage

Lower BAB(BUT higher total attack bonus because of Dexterity, Weapon Finesse)

Hordes(until get bard spells, scrolls, items, that deal with hordes)

Undead.

Basic idea is to have monsters uselessly waste attacks on character, as if character was a pincushin, while the character, shadow, henchman EVENTUALLY finish off enemy

Or to use Bard Spells, items, scrolls, etc, to deal with hordes

Or to hide, sneak up to ambush, assassinate, deathstrike

So HOW should I, others build this?

CONSTRUCTIVE ideas, help, suggestions, builds, examples, etc, PLEASE!

Thanks for any help!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Here is something I have thrown together that might work for you.
It is a dex based halfling. I have made the build to 40, but you can stop at 18 for the OC, or 28 for HotU if you want.
There are some skillpoints extra inlate  epic levels that can be put wherever you want.
Dual wielding is an assassin thing for more attacks per round (see my assassin guide). You may swap it for Blind fight and Improved knockdown.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Thanks. I like, agree with between some to almost most of your build. Why not more Shadowdancer levels, at the expense of Assassin levels?

How about get Shadowdancer to at least 4 to 7?

I assume that Bard is at 8 to get 3rd level spells. But how about bard levels high enough to get 4th level spells at I think 10th level bard, for better bard spells/song?

That brings Assassin levels down to about 19 to 24 which I would think would still be pretty good.

What about using a shortsword, rapier, instead of dagger?

What about Whirlwind Attack, Circle Kick, to full monty your attacks per round?

How about Disarm, Improved Disarm, Knockdown, improved knockdown, Improved Critical on either dagger, shortsword, rapier?

Just some of my thoughts

Thanks for your help, thoughts, etc.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
SD is there for HIPS. You also get evasion from the second level. But the second level is only there because it adds +1 to BAB as opposed to a 9th bard level.
I squeeze in as many assassin levels as possible.  That gives the best Death attack DC, maxes out Death attack damage. It also provides max bonus feats for Great dex X and a final dex of 38 for a fighter like AB of +43. AC is also above par.
An 8/8/4 split pre epic would have gained +1 BAB, but here AB becomes more than high enough with all the Great dex feats.
In short: This is an assassin build.
Bard is there to qualify for assassin.
Bard + SD levels = 10 because you can only take 10 assassin levels per epic. (I think Bard8/ SD2 is better than Bard6 SD4). You just get lvl3 bard spells. Choose wisely. Perform 15 just gives you the lvl 8 Song. Nothing major, but nice to have.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
I think I will go with 20th level build:

Bard 7,8/Assassin 7,8/Shadowdancer 5

I want the HIPS, uncanny dodge, the summon shadow, the Shadow Evade, and Defensive Roll from Shadowdancer.

My 40th level build would be:

Bard 11(get 4th, 5th level spellcasting, and bardsong gives +2 to AC)/Assassin 24(is only down 6 levels, worth trade off for what get), Shadowdancer 5

How would optimize that level allotment?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I am sorry, but I don't understand what you want to optimize with that level spread. To me it seems like you want too much in and end up with a weaker build.
Assassin is best with as many levels as possible. 25 levels may be OK, but more is better.
If you want ED, Rogue is often better than SD. Builds with many SD lvls are rare. But you see some that aim at ED and SCV.
In the build I posted here, Bard works as a stepping stone for Assassin and SD.
More serious Bard builds often have 16, 20, 24 or 26 bard levels. The songs are main focus, Skills are also important. Magic plays a part in Bard builds, but even so, spells are not a #1 priority.
In a build with priority on Bard, I prefer Rogue over Assasin.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Now that I think of it, 3 more bard levels, from 8 to 11 only gives you 1 more spells level from 4th to 5th level spells, and +2 AC.

3 more Assassin Levels from 24 to 27 equals 2,3,4 more Great Dexterity epic feats which about equals, maybe even exceeds getting 1 more spell level, +2 AC from song.

But I am not giving up my HIPS, uncanny dodge, evasion, summon shadow, shadow evade, defensive roll from 5 levels of shadowdancer.

And 5 levels of rogue is not better then 5 levels of shadowdancer. Yes rogue gets a couple, few, some of the same things as shadowdancer, but still the rogue does not get summon shadow, shadow evade, HIPS.

And going from 27 to 30 level in Assassin , and 1,2 more great dexterity feats, is not worth losing summon shadow, shadow evade, defensive Roll by only going with 2 levels of Shadowdancer, 3 levels less then Shadowdancer 5.

So after thinking about it

40th level build

Bard 8(4th level spells, improved bard song)

Assassin 27

Shadowdancer 5

Also you dont have to go with the absolute maxed out full monty. When you do that, the build is not as well rounded, less versatile, can have a, or more weaknesses, less complementary, synergistical, cooperative, interchangeable, abilities that work well with other abilities.

There are many times that I used a too narrow, too optimized, too full montied character against itself, as a DM, by throwing things at its weaknesses that it couldnt deal with, mitigate, etc.

On the flip side you dont want to be too WATERED down.

Neither Bard 11/Assassin 24/Shadowdancer 5

Or

Bard 8/Assassin 27/shadowdancer 5

Neither of those 2 builds Level allotment wise is too watered down, and instead is, are still semi optimized, semi narrow, semi almost full monty, semi focused, semi synergistical

And both builds have good enough versatility, that they can deal with, mitigate some build weakness, that they might not be able to deal with if were more narrow, focused, etc.

For example, the summon shadow, combined with summon monster spell combined with henchman, helps deal with Hordes, helps take the HEAT off you, so that can survive longer, etc.

And thats just the summon shadow.

Shadow Evade adds +3 to +4 to +5 to AC, combine that with +2 to AC from bard, and your AC goes from the 53 you listed to 60, 7 points better.

Defensive Roll adds a lot to your AC(+5 to +15 on average depending on what roll to your AC

Now your AC goes from 53 to 60 to 65 to 75 AC.

I know "Dont care about AC, because Ambush, Assassinate, Insta Kill IF undetected".

But what happens IF that doesnt work?

Your going to want a high AC like 75.

So gaining 3 to 6 levels of Assassin to Assassin 27 to 30 from 24, and being able to "KILL EVEN MORE ON TOP OF THE KILL MORE YOU ARE A LITTLE TINY BIT SLIGHTLY BETTER" is not going to make up for losing 3 shadowdancer levels, 3 bard levels, and what lose in losing a spell level, +2 to AC song, Shadow evade + to AC, Defensive Roll to AC, Summon Shadow.

Its like you deal 1 zillion damage, way more then enough, and now you want to deal 100 more damage instead of getting nice shiny things that augment, complement, synergize, give you versatility, etc.

Its also like if you had a 100 AC, almost impossible to be hit, and you want to add 25 to 50 more to 100 AC for 125 to 150 AC by adding 3 to 6 more levels of a certain class, instead of adding versatility, etc.

When is enough, enough?

When can you diversify, add versatility, etc?

I know there are builds that are WATERED down too much, and that that is a legit concern, and that you dont want to WATER down the build, but I am not WATERING down the build.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Asturonethoriusaline, now I start to like this thread!
You address several important things here:
When to max and when not to.
Versatility vs single focus.
What do the different classes bring to the table, and what is the optimal balance between them?
How can one class cover the weaknesses of another class in the build?
Where does one want to go with a build, sometimes one has to prioritize.
I have also added:
Will a build idea be better met if one picks other classes?

You have suggested 11/24/5 and 8/27/5 spreads. Why don't you post one or both of them so we have something more tangible to discuss.

On a side-note. Have they changed defensive roll recently and added an AC bonus?
I know that Shadow evade has an AC bonus. At SD5 it is +1 AC for 5 rounds.
If you play on a PW where SD and the SD feats have been changed, things may look completely different of course.

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content: Or has Defensive Roll been confused with Epic Dodge?

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
I'm new to the forum, but not so new to the NVWN 1 game, as I EASILY beat the OC, Shadows of, Hotu, but havent played the game in about 10 years.

Since new to forum I dont know how to, not good at, posting a build in a organized, broke down way, and it takes a long time, since I am a slower typer.

Also, while I now have an idea of what level allotment I want, I dont know exactly what I want to put into the level allotment shell. I have a rough idea, but not enough to post a organized breakdown

As to your question on would the build be better met if chose another class?

I was building a monk/Assassin/Shadowdancer

But I noticed that the lack of either a druid or wizard in the build made it so that couldnt buff up the character as much, liked I liked with a similar Monk/Wizard/Rogue, amd Monk/Druid/Rogue builds

The problem was couldnt have a Monk/Wizard or Druid/Assassin/Shadowdancer build.

I also tried Rogue/Assassin/Shadowdancer, but again I saw buffing was needed, and couldnt get buffing with a Assassin/Shadowdancer build, unless either did a Bard or Wizard or Sorcerer Shadowdancer/Assassin build.

Also the bard was showing up prominently in the Bard/RDD/PM builds

And Bard is a better choice then Druid, Wizard, because can sing buff, spell buff, can heal, can wear armor, shields, ok weaponry, better base attack, almost as good as the monk, offers good skill point allotment, and is similar, offers similar enough synergy to the Assassin/Shadowdancer classes

So by going with a bard/Assassin/Shadowdancer it is like going with.either a rogue, or Monk, wixard, shadowdancer, Assassin, all rolled into 1.

Best synergy, versatility, optimization with Bard/Assassin/Shadowdancer over almost any X/Assassin/Shadowdancer combo.

I thought Shadow Evade was at least a base of +2 plus the ocassional +1 per every so many SD levels

But probably misremembered it. It has been awhile. I dont play multiplayer, PW, at least not yet, or only 1 to 3 times at most.

As far as Defensive roll I thought it either was to roll a D20 to add result to AC or like Parry to roll D20 to parry a attack. At least that what I remember from my days playing this game and on PNP as a player and a DM. Probably wrong about it.

But COLLECTIVELY combined together, I think Summon Shadow at 3rd SD lv, Shadow Evade at 4th SD lv, and Defense Roll at 5th SD level, and +2 AC, 1 more spell level to go from 4th to 5th level spells, ALL combined together, in a VOLTRONIC combining to form Voltron effect is WORTH 3 to 6 levels less of Assassin.

I also just think 30 levels of Assassin is just too much. Especially considering that some multiplayer/PW has a level cap at 30.

But anything less then 24 to 27 Assassin levels and miss out on a lot of great dexterity feats.

posts.content:
Take a like, just because you mentioned Voltron & I remembered my childhood.
Also, once you decide what do you want to play, after all, go and play Aielund, the best module in Neverwinter Nights. It has been updated for both diamond & EE & it is better than ever.
It makes the OC/SoU/HotU seem like toys. It goes all the way up to 37th level & there you can actually use all these cool skills that your build has.

Good luck.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Let me try & answer your questions one-by-one,

a) Aielund is a mod. It is a player-created content that you can download & play it for free, like any other module(except the premium Bioware ones).
There is a place for these modules & other cool stuff and it is called Neverwinter Nights Vault. The link is below,
Neverwinter Nights Vault => https://neverwintervault.org/

b) Aielund & any other module that exists for Neverwinter Nights, play wherever the main game plays.
If Beamdog made Neverwinter Nights available for smartphones or tablets then the modules will play on them too.
Where the main engine plays, the modules will play as well, in other words. Here is a link to our forums where we discuss Aielund,
the-aielund-saga-t515487.html

c) Aielund is co-op as well, I have played it with friends and I have played it as a single player experience and both times rocked. It is not PvP but PvE (player versus environment).
When you play in single player there are henchmen/henchwomen that you can take with you & they are not the dumb ones that OC has but smart and resourceful.
And there are plenty of them too.

Aielund as Max shouts in the module's thread is the greatest single player module that has ever been created for Neverwinter Nights.
In fact, it's so good that the author (Savant) has published a book about it. You can find it on Amazon as usual.

d) Favoured Soul, Soul Knife & Psychic Warrior are not in Aielund since it supports only the default classes.
You can add these classes with a hak-pack that it was popular back in the day (although it severely disturbed game balance) the PRC.
Most people had problems with it though & it is not easy to intergrade.
You can approach these classes philosophy however with the proper builds, it isn't that hard.

e) Now, I don't remember if Aielund allows for conflicted alignments, we will need the help of Empyre or Mick or Stagmeister here, they have played it more times than I.

Finally, if you do not know how to install those modules then don't hesitate to ask for help.
Neverwinter Nights has an incredible amount of really good modules (Bastard of Kosigan, Diablo - the Lord of Terror, Prophet, Swordflight, etc) and I suggest that you start playing those instead.

Have fun.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Went to the Vault again. Looked at Aielund. Went to download files section. Says need CEP, hakpacks, and the main files for each act, are in .rar extensions. If click these file download links, they will download to PC and Hybrid Tablet PC's, but they wont download to Android Smart Phones. And even if they could, probably would not be able to install as would probably would have to MANUALLY install.

And Smartphones are usually not designed to manually install. Usually you download from google play, or Amazon, or whatever source, then it auto installs after finished downloading.

That probably cant, wont happen with CEP, HAK PACK, .rar files that are usually designed for computer.

So unless you can help me, its probably a no.

Too bad, looks like a good series of mods.

If Aielund wants Mobile Smart Phone players, its probably going to want to make it so that can go to either google play, or Amazon, download the required batch of files(CEP, HAK, .RAR), in a batch program, that can download, auto install from google play, Amazon.

And that also probably goes for the mods that dont come with the game.

And that will probably take time, as NVWN 1 EE, came out on Android mobile smart phones, tablets, on google play about 2 months ago.

Also the mobile smart phone, tablet version of the NVWN 1 EE game does not have the DM client, Aurora, mod creator.

NVWN1 EE on PC has those things, but tablet, smart phones do not

So since the game on Smart phone dont have what the PC versions have, that why the other mods section on the game launcher, is empty, and why only have the main mods that come with the game, and why cant seem to download, install, play custom, community mods like Aielund.

So probably will have to wait and or go without.

And if there is a way, I dont see it, and will probably need some help.

And it seems like 99% of players playing this game are on PC, Hybrid PC tablets, as there are no topics, on this and beamdog forums, and have not gotten any responses to me asking for help on, about this issue

So it looks like its the main mods, multiplayer/PW list that came with game, unless you, others can help

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
If I get it right, you are playing from your smartphone is that correct?
Well, I searched a lot in order to find a way to help you Asturonethoriusaline and the best that I found is that page directly from Beamdog.
Here is the quote from that page:
" In order to install custom content to Neverwinter Nights: Enhanced Edition on Android, you will need a way to add files onto the Android file system.
We suggest you use a desktop computer and a USB connector cable (data cable)."

Otherwise, the procedure is easy enough to follow,
Here is the relevant passage again directly from Beamdog's page:
" Custom content downloaded to your desktop can be installed to Neverwinter Nights: Enhanced Edition on Android by dropping files into the appropriate sub-folder:
a) Modules should be installed to the modules folder
b) Hak packs should be installed to the hak folder
c) Talk tables should be installed to the tlk folder
d) Override packs should be installed to the override folder
e) Custom portraits should be installed to the portraits folder"

Here is the page of reference, updated on 4th of December,
Beamblog => http://blog.beamdog.com/2018/12/how-to- ... nt-to.html

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
That's all I could do man,
I hope you find a way to experience the awesome custom content for Neverwinter Nights somehow.

I have tried, am playing Arolith from the Multiplayer PW list. They have a server with mods, DM sessions running constantly that does not require me to install anything.

But the only reason playing there is to build a Monk/Bard/Assassin, as they allow that combination, lawful bards.

But RP is enforced, the time, rest, food, and water system drain your stats, if dont rest, eat, drink water in time. And even rats are, can be tough. You level up slower, after the first 2 near free level ups. And have to get 3 bard levels before will let me take monk level at level 4. There are server errors, glitchs, fast respawn rates that caused my character to die 2 times. You lose gold(unless banked), small amount of xp, every time die, and respawn at beginning of game.

They have a bonus gift, feat like system, at character creation. I took a +2 Dexterity gift that adds +1 ECL(Makes you earn more xp to level up) And a +4 to Hide, +4 to Move Silently gift(No + to ECL), +6 to Perform(no + to ECL)

Also beginning to think healing potions are either Almost non existent, an or dont want healing potions at lower level. Can't even find healing potions for sale by merchants, and if there were, sure they would cost like 1000 to 5000 gold for 1 cure light wounds potion.

But maybe thats because almost everyone can supposedly create items, potions, etc, by spending crafting points from creation, level up, on crafting skills, and then finding the right materials, then sometimes paying gold, to make item.

Also if use any kind of magic, must have a deity, must pray to that deity occasionally and must pay at least 100 gold occassionally if want higher level spells to work.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I think the usual order would have you doing the Beggar's Nest before Blacklake. Blacklake might be hard than it is supposed to be for you, followed by the Beggar's Nest being "too easy". On the other hand, the OC does attempt to adjust for your level being "too high" or "too low", so it might work out alright anyway, except for the bosses and mini bosses.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Yeah your right. Meldanenan's apprentice (Master has the Dryad cure reagent)is kicking my arse.

Part of the trouble is that after using Tomi, I went with the cleric, then the bard. The bard hangs back too much allowing the apprentice to get off its deadly ice area of effect.

The other part of problem is that altho I sneak in, death strike paralyze the apprentice wizard for 2,3 rounds, after that, despite doing damage that should interrupt doom spell, the apprentice still gets off spell over and over. Thing must have epic CONCENTRATION SKILL IGNORE DAMAGE FEAT STILL CAST SPELL FEAT.

So I'm either going to go grab Grim the Monk or red tiger, and see if that helps. Probably will.

But if doesnt will go to beggars nest next. Then come back. Beggars nest is where I was, am going next anyways.

Except for the apprentice, and Loxar, and the Tyr Tomb Quest area, Blacklake has been a relatively piece of cake, extremely easy.

Also need to find some poison to use now that prestiged into assassin.

Also the sooner get uncanny dodge and evasion the better.
